title: Increases the jurisdictional limit from $3,000 to $5,000 for justice courts
summary: Increases the jurisdictional limit from $3,000 to $5,000 for justice courts.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2091

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 13, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. ZEBROWSKI, HAYES, GALEF, O'DONNELL, DenDEKKER,
         GUNTHER, REILLY -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. PHEFFER,  WEISENBERG
         -- read once and referred to the Committee on Judiciary

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  uniform justice court act, in relation to civil
         jurisdictional limits

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision a of section 201 of the uniform justice court
    2  act, as amended by chapter 685 of the laws of 1977, is amended  to  read
    3  as follows:
    4    a.  The court shall have jurisdiction as set forth in this article and
    5  as elsewhere provided by law[, subject, in the  case  of  a  city  court
    6  governed by this act, to the limitations stated in S 2300 (b) (2) (i) of
    7  this act]. The phrase "[$3000] $5000", whenever it appears herein, shall
    8  be  taken  to  mean  "[$3000]  $5000  exclusive of interest and costs"[,
    9  except that, in the case of a city court  governed  by  this  act  whose
   10  monetary  jurisdiction  is,  pursuant to S 2300 (b) (2) (i) of this act,
   11  below $3000, it shall be taken to mean such lesser sum as is  applicable
   12  in the particular court, exclusive of interest and costs].
   13    S 2. Section 202 of the uniform justice court act, as amended by chap-
   14  ter 685 of the laws of 1977, is amended to read as follows:
   15  S 202. Money actions and actions to recover chattels.
   16    Notwithstanding  any  other  provision  of  law,  the court shall have
   17  jurisdiction of actions and proceedings for the  recovery  of  money  or
   18  chattels  where  the  amount  sought to be recovered or the value of the
   19  property does not exceed [$3000] $5000.
   20    S 3. Section 1801 of the uniform justice  court  act,  as  amended  by
   21  chapter 76 of the laws of 1994, is amended to read as follows:
   22  S 1801. Small claims defined.
   23    The  term  "small  claim"  or "small claims" as used in this act shall
   24  mean and include any cause of action for money only  not  in  excess  of

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00691-01-1

       A. 2091                             2

    1  [three]  FIVE thousand dollars exclusive of interest and costs, provided
    2  that the defendant either resides, or has an office for the  transaction
    3  of  business  or a regular employment, within the municipality where the
    4  court  is  located. However, where a judge of the county court, pursuant
    5  to subdivision (g) of section three hundred  twenty-five  of  the  civil
    6  practice law and rules, transfers a small claim from the town or village
    7  court  having  jurisdiction  over  the matter to another town or village
    8  court within the same county, the court to which it is transferred shall
    9  have jurisdiction to determine the claim.
   10    S 4. This act shall take effect on the first of January next  succeed-
   11  ing  the  date  on  which  it shall have become a law and shall apply to
   12  actions or proceedings filed on or after such date.
